executive_summary.one_liner: Comprehensive terms with mandatory arbitration and broad content licenses that limit user legal options significantly.
key_takeaways: You must resolve all disputes through individual arbitration, waiving your right to jury trials and class action lawsuits
Spotify gains an irrevocable, worldwide license to use any content you post, including modifying and distributing it freely
The company can terminate your account or change the service at any time with minimal notice and limited refund obligations
You must indemnify Spotify for any claims arising from your use, potentially making you liable for legal costs
Price changes can occur with advance notice, and continued use means automatic acceptance of new pricing

dangerous_clauses.title: Mandatory Individual Arbitration with Class Action Waiver
dangerous_clauses.summary: You must resolve all disputes through individual arbitration and cannot participate in class action lawsuits, significantly limiting your legal options and making it expensive to pursue small claims.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: YOU AND SPOTIFY AGREE THAT EACH MAY BRING CLAIMS AGAINST THE OTHER IN ARBITRATION OR LITIGATION ONLY IN YOUR OR ITS INDIVIDUAL CAPACITY AND NOT AS A PLAINTIFF OR CLASS MEMBER IN ANY PURPORTED CLASS, COLLECTIVE, CONSOLIDATED, PRIVATE ATTORNEY GENERAL, OR REPRESENTATIVE ACTION.
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: You lose the ability to join with other users in class action lawsuits, making it financially impractical to pursue claims for small amounts of money. Arbitration costs and complexity may prevent you from seeking justice.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Understand that you have 30 days to opt out of changes to the arbitration agreement by sending a personally signed email to tounotice@spotify.com. Consider doing this if you want to preserve more legal options.

dangerous_clauses.title: Irrevocable Worldwide License to Your Content
dangerous_clauses.summary: Spotify receives a permanent, irrevocable license to use, modify, and distribute any content you post, even after you delete your account, with no compensation to you.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: you hereby grant to Spotify a non-exclusive, transferable, sublicensable, royalty-free, fully paid, irrevocable, worldwide license to reproduce, make available, perform and display, translate, modify, create derivative works from, distribute, and otherwise use any such User Content through any medium
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: Any playlists, comments, reviews, or other content you create becomes Spotify's to use forever, including selling or licensing to third parties. You cannot revoke this permission even if you close your account.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Only post content you're comfortable with Spotify using indefinitely. Avoid sharing personal information, original creative works, or anything you might want exclusive control over later.

dangerous_clauses.title: Termination Without Liability or Refunds
dangerous_clauses.summary: Spotify can terminate your account at any time if they believe you breached terms, with no liability to you and generally no refunds for prepaid subscriptions.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: Spotify may terminate these Terms or suspend your access to the Spotify Service at any time if we believe you have breached any of these Terms... you agree that Spotify shall have no liability or responsibility to you, and (except as expressly provided in these Terms) Spotify will not refund any amounts that you have already paid.
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: You could lose access to your account and any prepaid subscription fees without warning if Spotify determines you violated their terms, even if you disagree with their assessment.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Keep records of your account activity and payments. Carefully review the User Guidelines to avoid unintentional violations. Consider monthly rather than annual subscriptions to minimize financial risk.

dangerous_clauses.title: Broad User Indemnification Requirement
dangerous_clauses.summary: You must defend and pay for any legal claims against Spotify arising from your use of the service, including attorney fees, potentially costing you thousands of dollars.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: You agree to indemnify and hold Spotify harmless from and against all damages, losses, and expenses of any kind (including reasonable attorneys' fees and costs) arising out of or related to: (1) your breach of any of these Terms; (2) any User Content you post; (3) any activity in which you engage on or through the Spotify Service; and (4) your violation of any law or the rights of a third party.
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: If someone sues Spotify over something you posted or did on the platform, you must pay Spotify's legal defense costs, which could be substantial even if you did nothing wrong.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Be extremely cautious about what you post and share. Consider whether you have liability insurance that might cover such claims. Avoid any activity that could be construed as violating others' rights.

dangerous_clauses.title: Unilateral Terms Changes with Automatic Acceptance
dangerous_clauses.summary: Spotify can change these terms at any time, and your continued use of the service automatically means you accept the changes, even if you don't read them.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: We may make changes to these Terms from time to time by notifying you of such changes by any reasonable means... Your use of the Spotify Service following any changes to these Terms will constitute your acceptance of such changes.
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: You could unknowingly agree to worse terms simply by continuing to use Spotify. Important rights or protections could be removed without your active consent.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Set a reminder to check for terms updates periodically. Read notification emails from Spotify carefully. If you disagree with changes, you must cancel before they take effect.

dangerous_clauses.title: Severe Liability Limitations and Damage Caps
dangerous_clauses.summary: Spotify's maximum liability to you is capped at the lesser of what you paid in the last 12 months or $30, regardless of actual damages you suffer.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: AGGREGATE LIABILITY FOR ALL CLAIMS RELATING TO THE SPOTIFY SERVICE... MORE THAN THE GREATER OF (A) THE AMOUNTS PAID BY YOU TO SPOTIFY DURING THE TWELVE MONTHS PRIOR TO THE FIRST CLAIM; OR (B) $30.00.
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: Even if Spotify's service causes you significant harm or losses, you can only recover a maximum of $30 or your annual subscription fee, whichever is greater. This may not cover your actual damages.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Don't rely on Spotify for critical functions where service failure could cause significant harm. Maintain backups of important playlists or data outside the platform.

dangerous_clauses.title: One-Year Limitation Period for Claims
dangerous_clauses.summary: You must file any legal claim within one year of when you discover the problem, or you lose the right to pursue it forever.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: ANY CLAIM ARISING UNDER THESE TERMS MUST BE COMMENCED (BY FILING A DEMAND OR FILING AN INDIVIDUAL ACTION AS SPECIFIED UNDER THE ARBITRATION AGREEMENT BELOW) WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR AFTER THE DATE THE PARTY ASSERTING THE CLAIM FIRST KNOWS OR REASONABLY SHOULD KNOW OF THE ACT, OMISSION, OR DEFAULT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: You have a much shorter time to pursue legal action than typical statutes of limitations allow. If you don't act quickly, you permanently lose your right to seek compensation.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Document any issues immediately when they occur. Don't delay in pursuing complaints or legal action if you believe you have a valid claim against Spotify.

dangerous_clauses.title: Content Removal Without Notice or Explanation
dangerous_clauses.summary: Spotify can remove any content, including songs, podcasts, or your user content, at any time without notice or explanation, and has no obligation to provide specific content.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: Spotify has no obligation to provide any specific content through the Spotify Service, and Spotify or the applicable owners may remove access to particular songs, videos, podcasts, audiobooks and other Content without notice.
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: Your favorite music, playlists, or podcasts could disappear without warning. Content you created or curated could be removed at Spotify's discretion with no recourse.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Don't rely on Spotify as your only source for important content. Keep local copies of music you own and maintain backup playlists on other platforms when possible.

dangerous_clauses.title: Device Resource Usage and Advertising Rights
dangerous_clauses.summary: You grant Spotify the right to use your device's processor, bandwidth, and storage, and to deliver advertising to you through your device resources.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: You also grant to us the right (1) to allow the Spotify Service to use the processor, bandwidth, and storage hardware on your Device in order to facilitate the operation of the Spotify Service, and (2) to provide advertising and other information to you
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: Spotify can use your device's computing power, internet bandwidth, and storage space, potentially slowing your device or increasing data usage. You'll receive advertising that uses these resources.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Monitor your device performance and data usage. Consider premium subscriptions to reduce advertising. Be aware that the app may consume more resources than expected.

dangerous_clauses.title: Content Monitoring Without Obligation
dangerous_clauses.summary: Spotify may monitor your content and activity but has no obligation to do so, and can remove content for any or no reason without prior notice.
dangerous_clauses.exact_quote: Spotify may, but has no obligation to, monitor or review User Content (whether publicly posted or privately shared). Spotify reserves the right to remove or disable access to any User Content for any or no reason.
dangerous_clauses.user_impact: Your posts and activity may be monitored, but Spotify isn't required to protect you from harmful content. Content removal decisions are entirely at Spotify's discretion.
dangerous_clauses.recommendation: Don't expect Spotify to moderate all harmful content. Report violations when you see them, but understand enforcement is discretionary. Protect yourself by being cautious about interactions.
